Representative_Docs: ['Tosca Theresa Pardini Birth: 1931 Death: 2025 Tosca Theresa Pardini, beloved mother, Nonna, great grandmother, and cherished friend, passed away peacefully on Sunday, November 16, surrounded by the love of her family. On a dark, cloudy day, as the Frank Sinatra song “Fly Me to the Moon” played softly, a single ray of sunshine broke through and gently touched her beautiful face as she took her final breath with her family by her side. She was born at home in San Francisco on May 7, 1931, and she carried the spirit of the city with her throughout her life. Tosca later made her home in Ross, California, where she built a life centered on family, tradition, and enduring love. Tosca met the love of her life, Sergio Pardini, and they were married on February 17, 1952, at Saints Peter and Paul Church in North Beach. For sixty one adventure filled years they were inseparable and shared a deep devotion that guided their lives together. Known for her warmth, elegance, and quiet strength, Tosca created a home where everyone felt welcome. She was deeply proud of her Italian heritage and the traditions she lovingly passed down. Her kindness and grace touched all who knew her. Tosca loved traveling the world with Ser', 'Janet Marie Flores Birth: 1931 Death: 2025 Janet Marie Flores passed away peacefully on November 21, 2025 at the age of 94 surrounded by the love of her family. Jan was born on October 31, 1931 in San Francisco to loving parents Alice Detour and Joseph Hettrick. Jan was a loving mother, grandmother and great grandmother who found her greatest joy in her family. She had a way of making people feel welcomed. She was kind, big hearted, extremely gracious and devoted to those she loved. Her presence will be deeply missed. Jan lived a long life traveling, playing golf, bunco with her friends and one of her greatest talents was to find a treasure at garage sales. In her final years she enjoyed playing penny slots at the casino. The last nine years Jan spent in the loving care of her daughter and son in law. A special thank you to her granddaughter Samantha for making her last days warm, comfortable and full of love. Jan survived by her daughter Tina Schilling (Michael), her grandchildren Michael (Marissa), Paul (Kacie), Samantha (Carlos), and her nine great grandchildren Jackson, Aubrey, Jordan, Mikey, Ellie, Luna, Ryder, Makayla and Stella. And her friends who will forever cherish her memory. Celebration', 'Linda Sue (Jordan) Schlosser Birth: 1950 Death: 2025 Linda Sue (Jordan) Schlosser March 16, 1950-December 15, 2025 passed away peacefully surrounded by her family at her home in San Pancho, Mexico. Survived by her husband of 41 years, Phil Schlosser, her mother Gerry, daughter Kelly Noel, son Kevin Noel and wife Jennifer and her grandchildren Trevor and Lena. She was preceded in death by her father, Wayne Henry Jordan and brother Michael Wayne Jordan. Linda was born and raised in San Rafael, CA and graduated from Terra Linda High School. Linda loved sunshine, warm weather and travel. She was an outstanding cook and loved to entertain. Her great adventure was moving to Mexico, building a wonderful home filled with warmth, family, friends and great meals. She loved traveling throughout Mexico and Italy. Her family requests that gifts in lieu of flowers be made in Linda’s name to St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital. Representative_Docs: ['Asking Eric: Family, friends don’t seem to appreciate time I put into tedious Christmas cookie tradition Dear Eric: My late mother made a special Christmas cookie that required tedious decorating, considering each person’s personal preference for toppings, and giving them as gifts to family and friends. They always had a place of honor on our family Christmas table. When she was no longer able, she gave me the cookie cutter, and my daughters and I took over the family tradition. Representative_Docs: ['‘UK public have tougher stance on immigration and diversity than people in US’ People in the UK are less likely than their US counterparts to feel diversity strengthens society and more likely to have tougher attitudes on immigration, according to research. The findings are said to show that a common narrative about Britain being more socially liberal than America does not ring true across all issues. The National Centre for Social Research also found Reform UK voters in Britain were more likely than supporters of President Donald Trump in the US to say immigrants living in their country without permission should not be allowed to stay. Representative_Docs: ['Greg Fisilau looks ready for Test rugby in Exeter’s sloppy win over Leicester In the season of feasts, Exeter could not have made much more of a meal of this if they had tried. It was not until Stephen Varney’s score in the 72nd minute that the Tigers – who now end the year outside the top four – were put to bed.
